column4: hey guys. i'm having a very frustrating time getting my res over 1024x768.  i've got 1680x1050_60.00 mode added through xrandr, and when I try to set it I get a crtc error?  anyone please help?  http://pastebin.com/m51533ff0
(note, I've done a LOT of searching w/o any look concerning my video resolution)
did you turn off compiz to try it?
is compiz turned on my default?  i haven't messed with it since a fresh 9.10 install
yes, System Preferences, Appearance, visual effects----- none
ok i turned it off, I still get
with ati gfx, you may need a reboot,,, ati=sux
why you using xrandr? have you updated the install #1, #2, are u using the restricted drivers in "Hardware Drivers"???
and plz dont tell me you downloaded the drivers from nvidia and using those

no i downloaded the one from apt and no drivers show up on hardware drivers but display settings makes me use nvidia x server settings.  I restarted after installing the driver.  I'm trying xrandr so I don't have to keep restarting my computer to try different resolutions
ok,,, you jumped the gun then,,, after you update you' should see them in System>Administration> Hardware Drivers 185(recommended)
right -- i've seen this before but for some reason I don't now.  I recentlly uninstall everything nvidia before installing it again.. now even after installing it I don't see it.
xorg.0.log shows that nvidia driver is being loaded tho
i sec, i have new install of 9.10 also, letme look a sec... (i'm beginning to hate 9.10)
try sudo apt-get install ubuntu-restricted-extras
big download.. i'll try it out -- i know i've seen that package before from the 8.x days

yeah,,, i'm beginning to get tired of things just changing,,, i've devoted a section of my website for tutorials on doing various things in Ubuntu,,, i'm getting tired of having to write new ones with every release,,, gonna just stick to LTSs from here out
I'm tempted to reinstall 8.04/10 because they are the last versions that i don't recall having any video problems with.. i love linux but the video driver problems really suck
thanks for the suggestion.. i just hope this package helps
ok it's installed.. i suppose the thing to do now is restart
unfortunatetely but you can just restart x...
and see my pm
